name: friday the fish
notes:
a little fish! based on a goldfish, but can of course be made in any colour you like.
this pattern can be entirely no-sew and made with one continuous strand of yarn (somewhat fiddly), or alternatively the fins can be made separately and sewn on (easy). the pdf includes instructions for both.

pattern was designed using dk yarn and a 3.5mm hook and will make an approx 4 inch fish. you can make a larger or smaller fish by using a different yarn weight and hook size, but i have only made this in dk so your results may vary.

**recommended materials:**
- 3.5mm crochet hook
- dk yarn in colour(s) of your choice; this fish is
  based on a carp/goldfish but can be made in any 
  colour.
- toy stuffing (a good way to use up scraps
   of yarn!)
- needle, scissors, pins, stitch markers
- for the eyes: black (or contrasting)
  and white embroidery thread, or alternatively 
  4-5mm safety eyes or round beads

**pattern uses us terms:**
slst = slip stitch
sc = single crochet
hdc = half double crochet
dc = double crochet
inc = increase (2 sc in same stitch)
dec = decrease (sc2 together)
flo = work in front loop only
blo = work in back loop only
shift stitch= at the end of the current round, move stitch marker forward (if right handed) or back (if left handed) one stitch. count the stitch after the marker as stitch 1 of the new round.
